item.title: Remembering Fitzgeralds: A Classic Era of Downtown Las Vegas
item.description:
From Sundance to Shamrock: The Early Years

Fitzgeralds Hotel and Casino, a familiar sight on the eastern edge of Fremont Street, didn’t always bear that beloved name. Its story begins in 1980 as the Sundance Hotel, a project spearheaded by the legendary Moe Dalitz and operating partners Al Sachs and Herb Tobman, a powerful trio also connected to the Stardust and Fremont casinos. The Sundance quickly became a vital piece of the burgeoning downtown Las Vegas landscape. It was a time of rapid growth for Fremont Street, still very much the heart of Las Vegas entertainment. The tower’s impressive 34 stories immediately made it a notable landmark, offering guests fantastic views of the bustling street and the ever-evolving neon scene.
